title: Sergio Nichiporuk
text:
Sergio Nichiporuk (born 24 February 1957 in <a href="Itap%C3%BAa%20Department">Itapúa Department</a>) is a retired <a href="Paraguay">Paraguay</a>an nationalized <a href="Chile">Chile</a>an <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29%23Striker">striker</a>.
Playing career.
Nichiporuk began playing football in the youth teams of Paraná. In 1975, he moved to the capital <a href="Asunci%C3%B3n">Asunción</a>, where he made his professional debut with <a href="Club%20Nacional">Nacional</a> at the age of 18. Nichiporuk also played for local rivals <a href="Club%20Presidente%20Hayes">Presidente Hayes</a> and <a href="Club%20Sportivo%20San%20Lorenzo">San Lorenzo</a>, before <a href="%C3%91ublense">Ñublense</a> manager Manuel Rodríguez Vega signed him in 1980.
After several seasons playing in the Chilean leagues with Ñublense, <a href="Santiago%20Wanderers">Santiago Wanderers</a> and <a href="Deportes%20Iquique">Iquique</a>, Nichiporuk moved to <a href="Spain">Spain</a>. In January 1983, he joined <a href="RCD%20Mallorca">Mallorca</a> where he made 15 appearances for the club during the 1982–83 <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a> season.
Nichiporuk joined Magallanes during 1984, but suffered a broken leg which limited his ability to play over the remainder of his career. After a spell with <a href="Deportes%20La%20Serena">La Serena</a> in 1986, he moved to <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> to join <a href="Atlante%20F.C.">Atlante F.C.</a> where he made six appearances for the club during the 1987–88 <a href="Liga%20MX">Primera División</a> season. He returned to Chile and finished his career with <a href="Lota%20Schwager">Lota Schwager</a>, scoring 12 goals during the 1990 season.
Coaching career.
A few years after retiring from professional football, Nichiporuk began coaching Tercera División side Municipal Las Condes. In 1995 he began his professional coaching career with <a href="C.D.%20Cobresal">Cobresal</a>. He has led Cobresal on several occasions, winning promotion to the Primera División in 1998, and leading the club to a famous victory over Antofagasta on his Clausura 2006 debut. Nichiporuk led <a href="Santiago%20Morning">Santiago Morning</a> to the <a href="2000%20Copa%20Apertura%20Final">2000 Copa Apertura Final</a>, losing 2–1 to <a href="Club%20Universidad%20de%20Chile">U. de Chile</a>. He also won promotion with <a href="Deportes%20Puerto%20Montt">Puerto Montt</a> in 2002.
